title: Hey Riot, regarding the Mage Update and Blood Lord Vladimir...
body:
So, we know that the most the Mage Update candidates will receive in terms of visuals will be updated animations and effects to support whatever changes go through (though I'm still hoping you do minor VU's in the future for them a la Maokai, Renekton or Singed).

But, of all the mage updates (Cassio, Zyra, Vel'Koz, Brand, Malz and Vladimir), only Vlad has a legendary skin.

Basically, what I'm asking (and hoping) is that you plan to grant a separate set of animations and effects for everyone's favourite Blood Lord. I look forward greatly with both eagerness and anxiety to see what you have planned for him and everyone else, but I'd personally feel a little cheated if Blood Lord Vlad ended up having the same particle effects as Classic.

Any plans to let **the skies rain red** in their own glory?

replies.body: Blood Lord Vlad will indeed have a unique animation as well as unique FX. Soul stealer Vlad will also have unique FX :)

That's wonderful news! Thanks for popping in and answering my query.

Are the unique animations more...substantial than the current difference between BL and Classic or about the same?

I would say that the animation standard at Riot is higher now then it was when Vlad was originally released. 

But that's all I will say for now.

Oh wait Reav3, does that mean you're the guy in charge of Vlad's update?

Does that mean we'll get a Dev Corner Vlad spotlight like we had for Vel and Malz earlier?
He is a product manager, not a game designer. Currently we don't really know who will work on Vladimir.

Correct, I am the product manager of the Champion Update Team. The designers will be doing Dev Corner Blogs on all the Mages    that we are doing for the mid-year Mage update though, so keep a look out for them over the next couple weeks.

It's something we would always consider depending on resources at the time. Most of the champion update artists are busy working on Taric, so it won't be possible in time for the Mage update. Future roster projects could always have minor VUs in them, but that would of course depend on resources at the time. We would never delay a roster project in order to get a VU out at the same time as the focus of the roster projects is on gameplay.
